Articles.Content: my kerbals will celebrate christmas... in about 10 years, they have to get to eeloo first so they can have a white christmas

My Kerbals dressed up N1 instead of a Christmas tree. It's more practical and you can fly to Moon with these antiques (although there is a possibility that it will be fireworks still in the atmosphere )

"snow" artifacts - my integrated GPU is shocked by this CPS with mods, I'm still waiting for a new video card)

My Kerbals are spending their holidays setting together with their families, eating snacks and singing their favourite Christmas carol.

It goes like this:

On the twelfth day of Kristmas my true love sent to me

twelve boosters boosting

eleven swivels swiveling

ten kerbals leaping

nine rovers rolling

eight tanks exploding

seven chutes not opening

six rockets wobbling

fiiive gooolden decouplers

four decaying orbits

three FPS

two capibaras

and a kraken in the tech tree

Edited December 17, 2023 by Bingmao
More posts removed.     Stick to the rules.
My Kerbals like to write mods
My kerbals will be spending their Kerbalmass spiraling towards the furthest reaching of the galaxy, as they have run out of fuel. At least jeb brought a kerbalmass cake.

Bill decided to kick of the celebrations early by using his expansive knowledge of the Kerbol System to take himself, 100 of his crew, and 10,000 embryos through the anomaly to a promised new land and begin a new wave of colonisation after the top scientists on Kerbin realised that the Kerbol system was doomed. 

Bill got close enough to the anomaly with his ship until it sucked his ship and his crew into oblivion....and left him alone in space stuck in his command seat...with 10 minutes of oxygen remaining.
My kerbals have staring contests... everyone wins.

With an orbital Christmas tree, of course!

Spoiler

Sorry about the rehashed pics from six years ago, but I don't have the time to create a new scene. But I did like the comment about a fireplace based on a low-thrust SRB...
I use the KAL controller to create oversized fireworks.
they spend it shipping moon pies to the mun
My Kerbals are building like "Christmas tree" rocket with small tanks as decorations.
My Kerbals sing carols blissfully unaware that they are about to burn up in Duna's atmosphere
my kerbals sacrifice a newcomer to a planet of their choice
My Kerbals doing the last tests on the new plane to go on vacation.
My kerbals celebrated by sledding on Eeloo: Sleds were made of structural pieces with lawn chairs strapped on
Mis Kerbals lo celebran haciendo helado de mimus y haciendo una prueba nuclear en la muna para posteriormente observar el espectáculo
My kerbals celebrate holidays with fireworks from a floating base on Laythe, with Jool in the background.
My kerbals would celebrate by going to the Mun in KSP if I had it

Well this is a cruel irony . I planned to spend it on the surface of jool  . But im suffering from a bug that stops me from starting a new game  .  So probably a Christmas   themed rocket on the ice caps or in polar orbit of something in ksp 1  .

 

Edited December 17, 2023 by speceballs

In a warm, cozy wooden cabin perched atop a small hill in the winter wonderland that is Eeloo, Bill roasts a christmas turkey above a running nuclear salt water engine - you know, for that extra, delicious radioactive flavour. Jeb, Bob and Valentina decorate the christmas "tree" (an assemblage of structural panels and struts painted green) with baubles that looks like the many celestial bodies of the Kerbolar system. All while Tim C is out playing Santa, his rocket sled pulled by a tamed Kraken. He carries with him scientific parts, discovereables and the like, presents for the many patient players out there, waiting for the FOR SCIENCE! update.

Celebrating the holiday by roasting Kerbal stuffed 'Onion' for the great Kraken.

Spoiler

(Note: Take out the kerbals before eating.)
My kerbals are preparing santa kerbal's sleigh for launch
